summary: Breast cancer biomarker testing averages 83% compliance, with strong ER/PR/HER2 testing but opportunities in expanded panel testing for PIK3CA, BRCA1/2, and PDL1.

financial_impact.math: $185,000/year = 21% avg testing gap (advanced markers) × 32 eligible patients × $27,500 precision therapy value

clinical_impact.description: Advanced breast cancer biomarker testing improves treatment selection and patient outcomes.

metrics.description: Improved progression-free survival with matched therapies
Overall survival benefit with biomarker-guided treatment
Higher objective response rate with matched therapies

peer_comparison.description: Leading breast cancer programs achieve >90% comprehensive biomarker testing compliance including expanded molecular panels.

financial_impact.math: $240,000/year = 24% gap to peer benchmark × 36 patients × $27,800 improved care value

action_steps.text: Implement expanded biomarker reflex panel for metastatic breast cancer
Create PIK3CA testing protocol for HR+/HER2- patients
Implement comprehensive NGS panel for all metastatic breast cancer
Create provider education on PIK3CA and BRCA testing indications
Develop PDL1 testing algorithm for triple-negative breast cancer
Establish biomarker testing KPI tracking by provider

suggestions.text: Consider germline testing pathway for hereditary risk
